raw.title: [BIP-485] Kill R Gauges
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/629

# Summary

The R stablecoin has recently experienced an [exploit](https://twitter.com/raft_fi/status/1723317254480425028) where R was continuously minted and exchanged across liquidity sources. The exploiter still has excess R tokens, which can be swapped for liquidity, making it irresponsible to incentivize liquidity for the token. R pools were not included in the most recent core pool bribe. Due to the instability of the token, and Raft's intention to sunset the current version of the protocol, it is not necessary to incentivize liquidity for these pools any further. 

# Motivation

Due to Raft sunsetting the current version of the protocol the R token should no longer be supported by BAL emissions. 

# Specifications

The DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the AuthorizerAdaptorEntrypoint at `0xf5dECDB1f3d1ee384908Fbe16D2F0348AE43a9eA` and call performAction using `0xab8f0945` for the `data(bytes)` argument and use each gauge address as the `target(address)`

R/DAI - `0x6f3b31296fd2457eba6dca3bed65ec79e06c1295`

R/sDAI - `0x3b861b81b086ef0cffa0b00cd2ddb3d545ec9b98`

R/wstETH - `0x6e7b9a1746a7ed4b23edff0975b726e5aa673e21`

Core pool status has already been removed for these pools, per discussion between the Maxis and the Raft team.

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-795] Kill Stale Gauges Q1 2025
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
PR With Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1816

**Summary and Motivation**

Per [BIP-750 2025 Gauge Management](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-750-2025-gauge-management-proposal/6248) the Balancer Maxis are responsible for killing gauges on a quarterly basis due to them becoming stale I.e. not voted for. The definition of stale as defined in the framework is a pool under 100k for >60 days and a pool without veBAL votes for >60 days. Removing these gauges from the system decreases overhead for gauge checkpointing, gas costs for the operation, and improves UX on the frontend and snapshot for gauge votes via Aura due to shorter lists and less clutter.

**Updated Kill Criteria**
* The gauge is flagged as worth killing if it has not received veBAL votes for >60 days, and the median TVL has been under 100k USD equivalent for >60 days ( [tracked by a dune query](https://dune.com/queries/4805654)).
* Gauges can still be killed at any time due to externalities, the rules above are simply meant to keep the system lean and efficient.

**Technical Specification**

The gauge list is generated by the data report from Defilytica https://balancer.defilytica.tools/gauge-kill-list which was used for this gauge removal set.

The DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the `AuthorizerAdaptorEntrypoint` at `0xf5dECDB1f3d1ee384908Fbe16D2F0348AE43a9eA` and call `performAction` using `0xab8f0945` for the data(bytes) argument and the “Gauge Address” list for each pool below will be used for the target(address) argument.

Edit:
* kill list set
* updated kill criteria

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-547] Migrate rETH Gauges [Arbitrum]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/796

**Summary:**

This proposal outlines a plan to start migrating various pools that include the rETH token on Arbitrum over the next six weeks. The specific pools affected are the [rETH/wETH](https://app.balancer.fi/#/arbitrum/pool/0xade4a71bb62bec25154cfc7e6ff49a513b491e81000000000000000000000497), [sfrxETH/rETH/wstETH](https://app.balancer.fi/#/arbitrum/pool/0x0c8972437a38b389ec83d1e666b69b8a4fcf8bfd00000000000000000000049e), and [cbETH/rETH/wstETH](https://app.balancer.fi/#/arbitrum/pool/0x4a2f6ae7f3e5d715689530873ec35593dc28951b000000000000000000000481) pools, all of which currently utilize the same rate provider. This would be done by killing the gauges of the current pools 6 weeks from the execution of this proposal, and adding the new gauges of the following pools to the controller as soon as possible.

[rETH/wETH](https://app.balancer.fi/#/arbitrum/pool/0xd0ec47c54ca5e20aaae4616c25c825c7f48d40690000000000000000000004ef): 0xd0ec47c54ca5e20aaae4616c25c825c7f48d4069

Child Gauge:[ 0x8ba2D53F34159C5C5e7add60B56C7dE3BBc1DA68](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x8ba2D53F34159C5C5e7add60B56C7dE3BBc1DA68#readContract)

Root Gauge:[ 0xf8A95653CC7ee59AfA2304DcC518c431a15C292C](https://etherscan.io/address/0xf8A95653CC7ee59AfA2304DcC518c431a15C292C)

[sfrxETH/wstETH](https://app.balancer.fi/#/arbitrum/pool/0xc2598280bfea1fe18dfcabd21c7165c40c6859d30000000000000000000004f3): 0xc2598280bfea1fe18dfcabd21c7165c40c6859d3

Child Gauge:[ 0x06eaf7bAabEac962301eE21296e711B3052F2c0d](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x06eaf7bAabEac962301eE21296e711B3052F2c0d)

Root Gauge:[ 0xEaF1eef5814D9be44D0dBFb54c7773844339B7F8](https://etherscan.io/address/0xEaF1eef5814D9be44D0dBFb54c7773844339B7F8#code)

[cbETH/rETH/wstETH](https://app.balancer.fi/#/arbitrum/pool/0x2d6ced12420a9af5a83765a8c48be2afcd1a8feb000000000000000000000500): 0x2d6ced12420a9af5a83765a8c48be2afcd1a8feb

Child Gauge:[ 0x5a0e92a55800BB5bFd5ec6C7340BfdE7f0947c3E](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x5a0e92a55800BB5bFd5ec6C7340BfdE7f0947c3E#code)

Root Gauge:[ 0xBE0967E7510604302b0F974E21A625D9f762B8bb](https://etherscan.io/address/0xBE0967E7510604302b0F974E21A625D9f762B8bb#code)

The core pool recycled fees generated by the 3 pools which will have their gauges killed in 6 weeks will be directed to the new pool gauges effective upon the new gauges being added to the controller, This is to slowly move the incentives over giving LP’s ample time to move into the new pools with as little friction as possible.

**Motivation:**

The migration is scheduled on this timeline to enhance the experience for liquidity providers. The migration’s root cause is due to a low severity issue with the current [rate provider](https://arbiscan.io/address/0xa73ec45fe405b5bfcdc0bf4cbc9014bb32a01cd2) that rETH is utilizing only on the Arbitrum network. The concern is the rate reverting to a value from a slightly earlier date. This is currently being mitigated by the rocket pool team and will be monitored by both teams. The expectation is this will be a non-issue until after monitoring is concluded, which will occur after the migration window. The new pools utilize the [new rETH rate provider ](https://arbiscan.io/address/0xd4e96ef8eee8678dbff4d535e033ed1a4f7605b7)addressing any relevant concerns.

**Technical Specification:**

Gauge Adds:

Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860 will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at 0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:

gauge(address): 0xf8A95653CC7ee59AfA2304DcC518c431a15C292C

gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

gauge(address): 0xEaF1eef5814D9be44D0dBFb54c7773844339B7F8

gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

gauge(address): 0xBE0967E7510604302b0F974E21A625D9f762B8bb

gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

Gauge Kills:

The DAO Multisig 0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f will interact with the AuthorizerAdaptorEntrypoint at 0xf5dECDB1f3d1ee384908Fbe16D2F0348AE43a9eA and call performAction using 0xab8f0945 for the data(bytes) argument and the “Root Gauge Addresses” list for each pool below will be used for the target(address) argument.

Root Gauge Adresses:

[rETH/wETH](https://app.balancer.fi/#/arbitrum/pool/0xade4a71bb62bec25154cfc7e6ff49a513b491e81000000000000000000000497): 0x00b9bcd17cb049739d25fd7f826caa2e23b05620

[sfrxETH/rETH/wstETH](https://app.balancer.fi/#/arbitrum/pool/0x0c8972437a38b389ec83d1e666b69b8a4fcf8bfd00000000000000000000049e): 0x49f530b45ae792cdf5cbd5d25c5a9b9e59c6c3b8

[cbETH/rETH/wstETH](https://app.balancer.fi/#/arbitrum/pool/0x4a2f6ae7f3e5d715689530873ec35593dc28951b000000000000000000000481): 0x56c0626e6e3931af90ebb679a321225180d4b32b

The gauge kills will be executed at week number 14 (April 1st 2024 - April 7th 2024) assuming gauge adds are executed at week number 8 (February 19th 2024 - February 25th 2024)

Core Pools Rerouting Configuration:

The currently empty [ core_pools_routing.json ](https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/blob/main/config/core_pools_rerouting.json) will be changed to read as follows to reroute core pool incentives from the old rocket pools to the new one.
```

{

“arbitrum”: {

“0xade4a71bb62bec25154cfc7e6ff49a513b491e81000000000000000000000497”: ”0xd0ec47c54ca5e20aaae4616c25c825c7f48d40690000000000000000000004ef”, “

“0x0c8972437a38b389ec83d1e666b69b8a4fcf8bfd00000000000000000000049e”: “0xc2598280bfea1fe18dfcabd21c7165c40c6859d30000000000000000000004f3”,

“0x4a2f6ae7f3e5d715689530873ec35593dc28951b000000000000000000000481”: “0x2d6ced12420a9af5a83765a8c48be2afcd1a8feb000000000000000000000500”

}

}

```

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-763] Enable Boosted GHO 3pool on Balancer v3
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
PR with payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1678

## Summary

In preparations for migrating GHO liquidity from Balancer v2 to v3, @TokenLogic proposes enabling the new Boosted 3pool gauge on Ethereum.

This pool is to be considered “core pool” under BIP-19, meaning the protocol fees earned by these pool would be used to bribe for votes on it.

Within this proposal legacy gauges not being used on Balancer v2 are to be sunset.

## Motivation

With several GHO liquidity pools on Balancer v2, this publication begins the process by proposing to enable a new Boosted 3pool gauge and migrating liquidity from our largest liquidity pool across to Balancer v3.

The [Boosted 3pool](https://balancer.fi/pools/ethereum/v3/0x85B2b559bC2D21104C4DEFdd6EFcA8A20343361D) is to deploy each asset into Aave v3 to earn yield.

- GHO into Aave Prime
- USDC into Aave Core
- USDT into Aave Core

For information specific to each of the constituents mentioned above, please refer to the following Balancer v2 forum post.

* [GHO/USDC/USDT Gauge Proposal](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-411-enable-gho-usdt-usdc-gauge-ethereum/5135)

You can find detailed information about all these assets in the [rate provider registry]( https://github.com/balancer/code-review/blob/main/rate-providers/registry.json), which serves as a comprehensive source for all relevant details required for the review.

We will also, use this opportunity to sunset a few under-utilised gauges across Arbitrum and Ethereum. 

The following Balancer v2 gauges are to be sunset:

| Network  |      Pool      | Gauge Address   |
| :------: | :------------:  | :---------------: |
| Ethereum | [GHO/PYUSD #1](https://balancer.fi/pools/ethereum/v2/0x4c4ed61d81f531dcb34ad4d498548917aba3d193000200000000000000000680)   | `0xb71C90F165cf99d4004499fF058E265Aa68fAC85`  |
| Ethereum | [GHO/PYUSD #2](https://balancer.fi/pools/ethereum/v2/0x8950e720eb51af9709a86941345844134517bcf40002000000000000000006e9)   | `0xAf1b4bfA0a69B9e669d925888b99741E15e37253` |
| Arbitrum | [GHO/USDC/USDT](https://balancer.fi/pools/arbitrum/v2/0xf890360473c12d8015da8dbf7af11da87337a065000000000000000000000570) | `0x7d907D8D66B6CAd285D4349F507EcdfD11FD23D2` |
| Arbitrum | [USDe/waGHO](https://balancer.fi/pools/arbitrum/v2/0x38161e9efb8de52d00a1eb0f773223fd28fdd7c20002000000000000000005a0) | `0xcfab2efef3affdd158568dc896115eac26b3c498` |

## Specification

### Enable Gauges

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the `GaugeAdderv4` at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments based on the table above:

Pool address: [0x85B2b559bC2D21104C4DEFdd6EFcA8A20343361D](https://balancer.fi/pools/ethereum/v3/0x85B2b559bC2D21104C4DEFdd6EFcA8A20343361D)
Gauge(address): `0x9fdD52eFEb601E4Bc78b89C6490505B8aC637E9f`
GaugeType(string): `Ethereum`

### Kill Gauges

The DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the `AuthorizerAdaptorEntrypoint` at `0xf5dECDB1f3d1ee384908Fbe16D2F0348AE43a9eA` and call performAction using `0xab8f0945` for the data(bytes) argument and the “Root Gauge Address” list for each pool below will be used for the target(address) argument.

## Disclosure

TokenLogic is a service provider to Aave DAO and receives no payment for creating this proposal.

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-316] Replace veBAL Gauge
raw.author: 0x512fce9B07Ce64590849115EE6B32fd40eC0f5F3
raw.body:
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/233

### Motivation

The current veBAL gauge directs emissions to a recipient, then the emissions must be withdrawn and deposited to the fee distributor. This is a permissioned action that can be deprecated by utilizing the latest `singleRecipientGauge` factory which has the capability to deposit tokens directly into the fee distributor. Once this new gauge is added to the checkpointer the process of distributing BAL emissions to veBAL will be fully automated.

### Specification

1.
The DAO Multisig `eth:0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the AuthorizerAdapterEntryPoint `0xf5dECDB1f3d1ee384908Fbe16D2F0348AE43a9eA` with the following arguments:

target: `0xE867AD0a48e8f815DC0cda2CDb275e0F163A480b` which corresponds to the veBAL gauge
data: `0xab8f0945` which corresponds to the function for kill()

2. 
The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the `GaugeAdderv4` at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following argument:

gauge: `0xb78543e00712C3ABBA10D0852f6E38FDE2AaBA4d` which corresponds to the new 10% capped gauge for veBAL

gaugeType: `EthereumSingleRecipientGauge`

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: The proposal to sunset BAL emissions and fee processing on the Balancer v2 Fraxtal deployment due to the gas token change is well-supported by voters and forum participants. It aims to avoid costly redeployment while maintaining operational integrity and fee distribution to veBAL holders.
key_arguments_for: Avoids costly full redeployment of Balancer v2 due to Fraxtal gas token change.
Maintains fee processing and distribution to veBAL holders and the DAO.
Strong positive forum support highlighting fiscal prudence and operational necessity.
Consistent stable voting timeline with unanimous support for the proposal.
key_arguments_against: No significant arguments against noted in forum discussion or voting data.

evidence.quote: Positive support citing the fiscal sense of avoiding redeployment and approval of fee processing continuation.
Unanimous votes for 'Yes, let's do it' with stable and early voting dominance.

evidence.reference: Similar past proposals BIP-829 and BIP-828
evidence.quote: Similar proposals had unanimous 'Yes' votes and showed positive TVL impact despite slight negative price impacts.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
• The proposal addresses a necessary operational issue caused by Fraxtal's gas token change, making redeployment impractical.
• Forum sentiment is strongly positive, with all substantive comments supporting the proposal, indicating community alignment.
• Voting timeline metrics show unanimous early and stable support for 'Yes, let's do it', reflecting clear voter consensus.
• Similar past proposals with comparable scope also received unanimous 'Yes' votes and led to positive TVL impact, supporting the decision to proceed.
• The recommendation aligns with aggregated forum sentiment, reinforcing that the vote reflects community views and prioritizes long-term protocol health.
